section.title: Turn Off Debug Mode
section.p: Turn off debug in Build.jar or manually set debug to false in res/prefs-default.ini.

section.title: Proofreader Tools
section.p: The proofreader tools (activated through vn.enableProofreaderTools) provide a convenient shortcut in the menu bar for proofreaders to report bugs or typos. Don't forget to turn it off before the final release.

section.title: Check Customizations
section.p: Make sure you've customized everything you want:

ul.li: The application icon: res/icon.icns, res/icon.ico and res/icon.png
The installer splash screen image: build-res/splash.png
When creating an Android port: build-res/splash-android.png
When creating an applet release: build-res/applet/header.jpg and build-res/applet/splash.jpg

section.title: Test Generated Release
section.p: After creating the release with Build.jar, test it on a variety of computers (preferably with different operating systems).

section.title: Creating a Distribution
section.p: Build.jar can be used to create a release (Regular, CD, Android or Applet). The release options are under the "..." button above the "Run Game" button.

section.title: Create Release
section.p: Packages your project and NVList files together ready for end-user distribution. The generated files are created in the releases folder. Four files are created by default:

ul.li: A Windows-only .exe installer (sends user to java.com if no Java installed)
A zipped application bundle for Mac OSX

section.title: Create CD Release
section.p: Creates a disk image (.iso) ready to burn onto a CD/DVD. Added to the CD are the Mac OS X application bundle, the no-installer .zip and a Windows-only .exe installer.

section.title: Create Applet
section.p: Creates an applet distribution for embedding into a webpage. The applet is created in dist. Warning: users will be given a threatening looking security popup when first running the applet.

section.title: Create Android Release
section.p: Opens the Android Build Config window, see the chapter on Android distributions for more details.

section.title: Obfuscation
section.p: The obfuscate preference determines if resources included in the distribution should be made harder to access by curious end-users. When obfuscation is turned off, resources are distributed in a regular res.zip file as opposed to a non-standard .nvl file when obfuscation is turned on.

section.title: Adding Files to a Distribution
section.p: All resources must be stored in the res folder. These files will be packed into a single .nvl file upon distribution. To add end user readable files to a distribution, place them in the build-res/extra-dist-files folder. Any files/folders stored there will be included in distributions in the game root folder as regular files.
